Description: Lip and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: reserved with black band at junction of lip and body; on lip, lower part of lotus and connecting tendrils; on body, black-figure decoration consisting of part of quiver and rear of lion skin covering head of Herakles; inscription on exterior.
Dimensions: Height: 3.80 centimetres (of the two joined sherds)
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1886,0401.1056.d and belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1056.a.
Beazley and Payne suggest this is an early rendering of the fight for the Delphic tripod, with Herakles going right, head turned back.
Bibliographic references: Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 260, no. 23)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 46, no. 5)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 376, no. B520)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 229, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0394) (Phase 1)
